section.title: Global System Preferences
section.para: Set these preferences before anything else in Koha

section.title: Acquisitions
section.para: These preferences are related to the acquisitions module.

section.title: acquisitions
section.para: Define if you would like Koha to use 'normal' budget-based acquisitions, or 'simple' bibliographic-data acquisitions.

listitem.para: simple = bibliographic-data acquisitions
normal = budget-based acquisitions

section.title: emailPurchaseSuggestions
section.para: This preference defines how to handle patron purchase suggestions made via the OPAC.

listitem.para: ON = patron suggestions are emailed to the email address defined in 'KohaAdminEmailAddress' preference rather than being managed by the Acquisitions module
Get there: More > Administration >Global system preferences > Admin > KohaAdminEmailAddress
OFF = Patron suggestions go into the Acquisitions module to be managed by staff
Get there: More > Acquisitions > Manage Suggestions

section.title: gist
section.para: Defines the 'Default Goods and Services tax rate.
This is a free text field where you can enter

listitem.para: 0 = disables GST
Enter the GST value NOT in %, but in numeric form (e.g., enter '0.12' for 12%

para.emphasis: IMPORTANT: Enter the GST value NOT in %, but in numeric form (For instance, enter '0.12' for 12%)

IMPORTANT: Be cautious when making changes to any system preference, as editing these fields will affect your system. If you are unsure of what the value should be or whether it should be changed, contact your system administrator.

section.title: AutoLocation
section.para: Blocks unauthorized IP Addresses from accessing staff client.

listitem.para: ON = IP authentication is enabled, blocking access to the staff client from unauthorized IP addresses. When ON rather than set the branch by selecting it, you set it by your IP address.

OFF = Anyone with a login can access the staff client no matter what IP they're coming from. When OFF the library branch can be changed using the 'set' link in the top right of the staff client menu. To enter the IP addresses that are allowed you must edit that in the administration module [
Get there: More > Administration > Libraries, Branches, & Groups > Edit Branch

section.title: DebugLevel
section.para: This setting determines the amount of detail that is sent to the screen about an error when a user encounters an error using the system.
TIP: You will typically set this to '0' in production, but can briefly change it to '2' if you encounter a particular error in which you need more information to report the problem.

listitem.para: 0 = shows no error info (other than the basic error message)
1 = some detail
2 = most detail

section.title: delimiter
section.para: Defines the default separator character for exporting reports to open in an external application. When report data outputs in Koha to an external file, it is done so in a value separated flat file (common types of this are comma separated values .csv files, tab delimited files, etc.). This setting allows the library(s) to decide what character they want to use to separate the columns of output data in the value separated flat file.
TIP: In the U.S., ';' is most common and makes the reports compatible with Microsoft Excel.

listitem.para: tabulation

section.title: FrameworksLoaded

listitem.para: userflags.sql|marc21_framework_DEFAULT.sql|stopwords.sql|sysprefs.sql|auth-types.sql|marc21_holdings_coded_values.sql|library.sql|itemtypes_default.sql|borrower_categories.sql|auth_val.sql

section.para: This field contains a list of all MARC framework scripts, syspref scripts, and sample data prefs loaded during the web installation.

para.emphasis: IMPORTANT: It is not recommend that this setting is changed after the initial installation of Koha.

section.title: GranularPermissions

listitem.para: ON = Adds the ability to provide more granular permissions to staff (such as allowing access to one or two tools instead of them all)
OFF = Permissions are assigned by function instead of allowing staff access to parts of a function

section.para: TIP: If this preference is turned OFF after being ON, the system reverts to the original behavior, although the specific permissions are retained. This means if a staff member has been given granular permissions they will retain those even if this is turned OFF

section.title: IndependantBranches
section.para: Use this setting if independent libraries are sharing a single Koha installation (each are a 'branch' in Koha).

para.emphasis: IMPORTANT: This setting is not intended to be used with normal library branches. This setting is meant for libraries who are independent organizations, meaning they do not share material or patrons.
IMPORTANT: The value (ON/OFF) should be set BEFORE going live and should NOT be changed. This setting is a precursor setting to the fuller system group work development forthcoming in Koha 3.2.

section.para: If ON, Koha will increase security between the libraries (ie, 'branches') in your Koha system. When 'IndependentBranches' is ON, Koha...

listitem.para: prohibits staff users from logging into another location from within the staff client, unless they have superlibrarian privileges.
filters out patrons from patron searches that do not belong at the login location. (If a patron is registered at 'C' Branch, a search at 'A' Branch won't bring up that patron.)
limits the location and sublocation choices to the login location, when adding or modifying an item record.
prevents users from other library locations from checking out or placing holds on material held at a different library location.
prevents staff from editing item records that do not belong to the login location.

section.para: All of this is with the exception of the superlibrarian. Superlibrarian is the highest level of privileges that can be granted to a staff user and entitles the user to do anything in the system.

listitem.para: ON = Bypasses all authentication (staff client and OPAC included). Be careful!
OFF = Requires authentication on the staff client and the OPAC

para.emphasis: IMPORTANT: it is not recommend that this setting is changed after the initial installation of Koha.

section.title: intranet_includes
section.para: Use 'includes' directory if you want specific look of Koha (includes or includes_npl, for example).

section.title: KohaAdminEmailAddress
section.para: Define the Koha Administrator email address.

TIP: It is recommended that you use the email address of a superlibrarian (e.g. Library Director, Head of Circulation, etc) Only one email address can be entered, however it can be changed at any time.
This email address will receive patron modification requests, purchase suggestions (if you choose to have them emailed), and information regarding overdue notices.

section.title: libraryAddress
section.para: Define the address to use for printing receipts, overdues, etc.

para.emphasis: IMPORTANT: You only need to enter an address here, if the address you want to use is different from the physical address you've assigned to the library in 'Libraries,Branches, & Groups'.

listitem.para: Get there: More > Administration > Libraries, Branches, & Groups

section.title: MIME
section.para: Defines the default application Koha will use when exporting reports.

listitem.para: EXCEL
OPENOFFICE.ORG

section.title: noItemTypeImages
section.para: Determines whether itemtype images display in the OPAC and staff intranet.

screenshot.screeninfo: Here is an example of itemtype images:

listitem.para: ON = itemtype images do not display
OFF = itemtype images are displayed

section.para: TIP: You can assign itemtype images to your itemtypes through the administration 'Item Types and Circulation Codes'

listitem.para: Get there: More > Administration > Item Types and Circulation Codes

section.title: OPACBaseURL
section.para: Here's where you specify the base URL for your OPAC. For example, opac.mylibrary.com
TIP: The 'http://' will automatically be added by Koha.

para.emphasis: IMPORTANT: It is not recommend that this setting is changed after the initial installation of Koha.

section.title: OpacMaintenance

listitem.para: ON = When on all functions in the OPAC will be disabled and replaced with a maintenance message
OFF = When off the OPAC functions as expected

screenshot.screeninfo: When ON the OPAC will look like this

section.para: TIP: The text for this warning cannot be edited at this time

section.title: SessionStorage
section.para: Use database or a temporary file for storing session data.

listitem.para: MYSQL
Pg
tmp

para.emphasis: IMPORTANT: it is not recommend that this setting is changed after the initial installation of Koha.

section.title: singleBranchMode
section.para: Defines if Koha should operate in 'single-branch' mode.

listitem.para: ON = Koha hides the branch selection functionality in the OPAC.
OFF = Koha displays the branch selection functionality in the OPAC.

section.title: staffClientBaseURL
section.para: Specify the base URL for your staff client.
TIP:The 'http://' will automatically be added by Koha.

para.emphasis: IMPORTANT: Remember, if you have not chosen a 'hosted' solution through a Koha service provider, you need to buy and register your own domain name.

section.title: timeout
section.para: Inactivity timeout for cookies authentication (in seconds). This preference applies to both the staff client and the OPAC.

para.emphasis: IMPORTANT: It is not recommend that this setting is changed after the initial installation of Koha.

section.title: Version
section.para: This refers to the Koha database version your installation is running.

para.emphasis: IMPORTANT: DO NOT change this after the initial installation of Koha. It is maintained by the webinstaller.

section.title: Authorities
section.para: These settings are related to using authority records in cataloging.

section.title: authoritysep
section.para: Defines the default separator character for separating a list of authorities in a display (Usually, '--')
Values: This is a free form field

para.emphasis: IMPORTANT: Most libraries leave this at the default: '--'

section.title: BiblioAddsAuthorities
section.para: Defines if a new biblio will check for existing authority record and create one on-the-fly if one doesn't exist.

listitem.para: ON = a new biblio will check for existing authority record and create one on-the-fly if one doesn't exist.
OFF = a new biblio will NOT check for existing authority records and will NOT create one if one doesn't exist

section.title: dontmerge
section.para: Defines if an authority record will update all associated bibiiographic records immediately.

listitem.para: ON = modifying an authority record will NOT update all associated bibliographic records
OFF = modifying an authority record WILL update all associated bibliographic records

para.emphasis: IMPORTANT: Ask your system administrator to enable the merge_authorities.pl cron job

section.title: Cataloging
section.para: These settings control the cataloging rules and interface.

section.title: advancedMARCeditor
section.para: Defines whether or not you want Koha's MARC editor ('Cataloging' Module) to display field/subfield descriptions.

listitem.para: ON = The MARC editor WON'T display field/subfield descriptions (for the advanced cataloger)
OFF = The MARC editor WILL display field/subfield descriptions (for the novice cataloger)

para.emphasis: TIP: Many advanced catalogers prefer to have this preference set to OFF.

listitem.para: incremental = assigns an item barcode as a sequential number 1,2,3,4 etc. (each library would have its own separate sequential run)
annual = the sequential number for each library is prefixed by the year code, i.e. 2007-1, 2207-2 etc.
hbyymmincr = assign an item barcode of the form HBYYMMincr, where 'HB' stands for the item's home branch, 'YYMM' stands for the year and month, and 'incr' is a sequential number
OFF = barcodes are not auto-calculated

para.emphasis: IMPORTANT: If javaScript is off the only option that will work is 'incremental'. To use other options, you must have JavaScript on.

section.title: DefaultClassificationSource
section.para: Here you set the default classification scheme used by the collection. e.g., Dewey, LCC, etc.

listitem.para: ddc (Dewey) * lcc (Library of Congress Classification)
sudocs (SuDoc number, for United States government documents)
udc (Universal Decimal Classification)
z (Other, e.g., for accession numbers)
ON = disables display of MARC fields, subfield codes & indicators (still shows data)-- see below Marc fields displayed

screenshot.screeninfo: Cataloging view with hide_marc set to ON

listitem.para: OFF = MARC fields, subfield codes & indicators will display-- see below No MARC descriptions

screenshot.screeninfo: Cataloging view with hide_marc set to OFF

section.title: IntranetBiblioDefaultView
section.para: Controls what bibliographic detail display (normal, ISBD, or MARC) is chosen when you click on a record in a catalog search results list on the staff client.

listitem.para: normal
isbd
marc
labeled_marc

para.emphasis: TIP: To update what displays in the OPAC, update the 'BiblioDefaultView' system preference, which is the equivalent of this preference for the OPAC.

section.title: ISBD
section.para: Here is where you re-order the variables that dictate ISBD display in Koha. The International Standard Bibliographic Description or ISBD is a set of rules produced by the International Federation of Library Associations and Institutions (IFLA) to describe a wide range of library materials within the context of a catalog.

para.emphasis: IMPORTANT: Most libraries leave this at the default. Do not delete values, rather re-order them to get a different display in Koha.

section.title: item-level_itypes
section.para: Here is where you decide if Koha will use item-level and itemtype issuing rules.

listitem.para: ON = Enables Item-level Itemtype / Issuing Rules
OFF = No Item-level Itemtype / Issuing Rules

section.para: Koha is different from some other ILSs in that the item type or loan code can either be an attribute of the bib record or an attribute of the item record. The 'item-level_itypes' preference controls whether the item type stored at the bib or item level is used for circulation policies.

section.title: itemcallnumber
section.para: Defines the MARC field/subfield that is used to calculate the itemcallnumber.

listitem.para: '082ab' or '092ab' = Dewey
'050ab' or '090ab' = LOC

section.para: In Koha, libraries will specify and store their local item level call numbers in 952$o which is the designated tag/subfield for storing an item level call number. They can have this 952$o populated by the bib level call number by using this field to specify which other tag/subfield in the bib record will be used to pull default item call number information from.

section.title: LabelMARCView
section.para: Defines how a MARC record will display.

listitem.para: standard
economical

para.emphasis: TIP: If there is a repeatable table on your label (e.g., 650) only the first occurrence will be displayed.

section.title: marc
section.para: Back in the early days of Koha, there was the ability to have a totally non-marc db and that was what this setting was for. Most libraries use MARC of one form or another now for their bibliographic and authority records so this setting is actually becoming obsolete and will likely be removed in the future.

para.emphasis: IMPORTANT: This is an ON/OFF setting that you will want to set ON and leave ON.

listitem.para: ON = MARC is supported
OFF = MARC is not supported

section.title: marcflavour
section.para: Defines global MARC flavor (MARC21 or UNIMARC) used for character encoding.

listitem.para: MARC21
UNIMARC

para.emphasis: IMPORTANT: This option should not be changed after installation of your database.

section.title: MARCOrgCode
section.para: Defines your library's MARC Organization Code. Learn more about MARC Organization Codes: http://www.loc.gov/marc/organizations/orgshome.html
This is a free text field that should be updated with your organization code before you begin cataloging.

para.emphasis: TIP: Search the list of codes (http://www.loc.gov/marc/organizations/org-search.php) if you're unsure of what your code is.

section.title: NoZebra
section.para: Here you decide to use the 'Zebra' or non Zebra version of Koha. Zebra is a high-performance indexing and retrieval engine. If ON, Zebra indexing is turned off and there is a simpler setup, but slower searches.

listitem.para: ON = No Zebra indexing (Consider using this only if your collection is very small-- under 25,000 items)
OFF = Zebra indexing is on (All collections over 25,000 items will want to choose this setting)

para.emphasis: IMPORTANT:
If your library's collection is over 25,000 you must have this preference to OFF to get fast searching.
It is recommended that this setting NOT be changed after initial installation of Koha.
Using this feature on a busy Koha installation has proven to be rather resource intensive.

section.title: NoZebraIndexes
section.para: Includes the actual definitions to use for Koha's internal search engine if you're not using Zebra

para.emphasis: IMPORTANT: Leave this value at the default provided.

section.title: OpacSuppression
section.para: This system preference only applies to the 942$n field.

listitem.para: ON = Makes it so that if the 942$n field is set in the framework to be suppressed in the OPAC, the bibliographic record will not appear in the OPAC
OFF = If the 942$n field is set in the framework to be suppressed in the OPAC, the bibliographic record will still appear in the OPAC

para.emphasis: TIP: Sometimes it's easier if you create an authorized value entitled 'SUPPRESS' with two values: 0 for don't suppress and 1 for suppress. Linking this authorized value to the 942$n field will make it so that catalogers can pick one of these two values.

IMPORTANT: Unless you have at least one record with a 942$n, turning 'OpacSuppression' ON will cause all OPAC searches to fail. This is caused by Zebra throwing errors if you search for an index that doesn't have at least one value.

section.title: RoutingSerials
section.para: Defines if serials routing lists are enabled or disabled in your system.

listitem.para: ON = Serials routing is enabled
OFF = Serials routing is disabled

para.emphasis: TIP: Learn more by viewing the Serials: Routing Lists section in this manual.

listitem.para: ON = When entering a barcode in the Quick Spine Label Creator it will automatically pop up the print dialog
OFF = When entering a barcode in the Quick Spine Label Creator you will see a preview before clicking print

section.title: SpineLabelFormat
section.para: Define the format of the quick spine label generated by the Quick Spine Label Creator.
Just list the fields you would like to see in the order you would like to see them, surrounded by <>

listitem.para: Example <itemcallnumber>

para.emphasis: TIP: Format your label printing by editing spinelabel.css found in koha-tmpl/intranet-tmpl/prog/en/css/

section.title: z3950AuthorAuthFields
section.para: Defines the MARC biblio fields for Personal Name Authorities to fill biblio.author field.

para.emphasis: IMPORTANT: You probably want to leave this set to the default. This option takes effect only if the 'z3950NormalizeAuthor' option is turned on; note that 'z3950NormalizeAuthor' should be used only by UNIMARC libraries.

section.title: z3950NormalizeAuthor
section.para: Here you can choose to have 'Personal Name Authorities' replace authors in biblio.author.

listitem.para: ON = Personal Name Authorities will replace authors in biblio.author
OFF = Personal Name Authorities will NOT replace authors in biblio.author

para.emphasis: IMPORTANT: This option is currently specific to UNIMARC, and should not be turned on by MARC21 libraries.

section.title: Circulation
section.para: Settings related to circulating your collection.

listitem.para: ON = A date field is displayed on the Hold screen of the Staff Interface, allowing the hold date to be set in the future.
OFF = Hold will be places as of today.

para.emphasis: TIP: To allow patrons to set future holds, OPACAllowHoldDateInFuture has to be set to ON first.

listitem.para: Get there: More > Administration > OPAC > OPACAllowHoldDateInFuture
ON = All staff to override the hold policies set in the circulation and fine rules when placing holds
OFF = No one can override the hold policies set in the circulation and fine rules
ON = Allow item-level hold requests to be placed on damaged items
OFF = Do not allow item-level hold requests to be placed on damaged items
ON = Librarians can loan items marked 'not for loan'
OFF = Items marked 'not for loan' cannot be loaned
ON = Allow item-level hold requests to be placed on items that are not on loan
OFF = Only allow holds on checked out items
ON = Allows renewal limits to be overridden on the circulation screen
OFF = Do not allow renewal limits to be overridden on the circulation screen

section.title: AutomaticItemReturn
section.para: Defines if Koha will automatically transfer an item to its home branch, or not.

listitem.para: ON = Items checked in at a location other than the home branch specified in their record will be set as in transit to their home location.

para.emphasis: IMPORTANT: This assumes you know what needs to be transferred, and initiates the transfer automatically without showing a notification message.

listitem.para: OFF = Items will not be set as in transit to their home location, instead staff will be asked whether or not the the item will remain at the library that checked the item. The check in location will show on the item record as the 'holding' location (like a temp location)

section.title: BranchTransferLimitsType
section.para: When using branch transfer limits, choose whether to limit by itemtype or collection code.

listitem.para: itemtype = Limit transfers by item type
ccode = Limit transfers by collection code

section.title: canreservefromotherbranches
section.para: With independent branches on, can a user from one library place a hold on an item from another library?

para.emphasis: IMPORTANT: This preference is dependent on the 'Independent Branches' preference being turned ON.

listitem.para: Get there: Administration > Global system preferences > Admin > Independent Branches
ON = A user from one library can place a hold on an item from another library
OFF = A user from one library cannot place a hold on an item from another library

para.emphasis: TIP: This is especially useful in consortial situations, where independent libraries may be sharing a Koha installation, but want to disallow borrowing between the libraries.

section.title: ceilingDueDate
section.para: If set, date due will not be past this date. Enter date according to the dateformat System Preference

listitem.para: If dateformat preference is set to 'iso' enter the date with the following format YYYY-MM-DD
Get there: More > Administration > Global system preferences > I18N/L10N > dateformat
If dateformat preference is set to 'metric' or 'us' enter the date with the following format MM/DD/YYYY
Get there: More > Administration > Global system preferences > I18N/L10N > dateformat

section.title: CircAutocompl
section.para: Defines if autocompletion should be enabled for the Circulation input
For example, if you're typing a patron's name in an attempt to pull up their account, if CircAutocompl is set to on name suggestions will appear

screenshot.screeninfo: Patron search with CircAutocompl turned ON

listitem.para: ON = autocompletion is enabled for the circulation input
OFF = autocompletion is disabled for the circulation input

section.title: CircControl
section.para: Specify the agency that controls the circulation and fines policy.

listitem.para: When a patron checks out an item, does the user's home library determine the length of checkout and fines policy?
Or, the library the patron picked the item up at?
Or, the home location of the item being checked out?
PickupLibrary = Circulation and fines for item determined by the library that the user picked the item up at
PatronLibrary = Circulation and fines for item determined by user's home library (set in their patron record)
ItemHomeLibrary = Circulation and fines for item determined by the home location of the item being checked out

section.title: DisplayClearScreenButton
section.para: This preference makes it so that your circulation librarians can easily clear the screen of any patron information (protecting the privacy of your patrons).

listitem.para: ON = A clear screen button will appear on the circulation page.
OFF = No clear screen button will appear on the circulation page.
ON = Koha emails the librarian whenever a hold is placed
OFF = Koha does not email the librarian whenever a hold is placed

para.emphasis: TIP: The only reason to have this function ON is if your library is very small and items are rarely put on hold. Libraries with many holds will want to monitor holds via the web interface to avoid email overload.

listitem.para: ON = The 'Overdues' report will not run without first selecting filters (this will eliminate long loading times associated with long reports)
OFF = The 'Overdues' report will run as soon as it is loaded, possibly causing slowness in your system

para.emphasis: IMPORTANT: This refers to the Overdues report found on the Circulation menu.

section.title: finesCalendar
section.para: Specify whether to use Koha's 'Calendar' module in calculating due dates and fines.

listitem.para: Get there: Tools > Calendar
noFinesWhenClosed = no fines will be calculated for days marked as a 'holiday' in the 'Calendar' module
ignoreCalendar = fines will be calculated with no consideration of the 'Calendar' module

para.emphasis: IMPORTANT: If you choose 'noFinesWhenClosed', you must set holidays using the 'Calendar' module for this preference to be useful.

listitem.para: Get there: More > Tools > Calendar

section.title: finesMode
section.para: Here's where you choose the fines mode Koha will use.

listitem.para: off = no fines are calculated, even if they have been defined in other modules
test = emails admin report * production = accrues overdue fines

section.para: This preference uses the email address defined in the 'KohaAdminEmailAddress' preference

listitem.para: Get there: Administration >Global system preferences > Admin > KohaAdminEmailAddress

para.emphasis: IMPORTANT: Requires fines.pl cronjob. Ask your system administrator for details.

section.title: globalDueDate
section.para: If set, allows a global static due date for all check-outs (issues).

listitem.para: If dateformat preference is set to 'iso' enter the date with the following format YYYY-MM-DD
Get there: More > Administration > Global system preferences > I18N/L10N > dateformat
If dateformat preference is set to 'metric' or 'us' enter the date with the following format MM/DD/YYYY
Get there: More > Administration > Global system preferences > I18N/L10N > dateformat

section.title: holdCancelLength
section.para: Specify how many days after a hold has been confirmed, pulled from the shelf and patron contacted before a hold is canceled.

The number you enter represents 'days'. For instance, if you enter '14', then Koha will cancel a hold and change the item's status to 'available' 14 days after the patron has been contacted to pick up the hold.

para.emphasis: IMPORTANT: This does not take into account a person's place in the hold queue, if they're 200th on the list of holds, and this limit is reached, their hold will be dropped. If you have a big library with a lot of holds, you may want to set this to an insanely high number of days.

section.title: HomeOrHoldingBranch
section.para: When 'IndependentBranches' is turned ON, 'HomeOrHoldingBranch' specifies whether one library is able to check out another library's item when the item is returned... or whether it has to "go home" (to its 'home branch') first!

Put another way: This preference answers the question "What should our library do with another branch's returned book? Can we check it out again ourselves, or does it have to go back to its home branch?"

para.emphasis: IMPORTANT: it is not recommend that this setting be changed after initial installation of Koha
IMPORTANT: This preference does nothing unless the 'Independent Branches' preference is turned ON.

listitem.para: Get there: Administration > Global system preferences > Admin > Independent Branches
holdingbranch = Koha will check the branch an item is being 'held' at

homebranch = Koha will check to see which branch is an item's 'home branch' and request that a holding branch return that item to its home when attempting to 'check in' the item or 'check out' the item to another patron

section.para: If the value is set to 'holdingbranch', you will be able to check in a book from another library/branch. When you do so, a reminder to return the item to its home branch will appear:

screenshot.screeninfo: Reminder to return the book to its home branch

section.para: You will also be ABLE to re-issue the item to another user at your library without first returning it to its home branch. If the value is set to 'homebranch', you will NOT be able to check in a book from another library/branch. When you do so, a warning occurs with a reminder to return the item to its home branch:

screenshot.screeninfo: Warning reminding you to return the book to its home branch

section.para: You will also be UNABLE to re-issue the item to another user at your library without first returning it to its home branch.

listitem.para: ON= any items run through returns.pl with a location code for 'PROC', will be modified to have a new location code of 'CART'

section.title: IssuingInProcess

section.para: Example: Your library has a $5 limit set for 'fines' (ie, after incurring $5 in fines, a patron can no longer check out items). A patron comes to the desk with 5 items to check out (4 books and a video) The patron has $4 in charges already on their account. One of the videos has a rental charge of $1, therefore making the total fines on the patron's account suddenly $5 (the limit).

listitem.para: If the preference was ON, fines would be disabled for the checkout session in order to let the patron continue their checkout

If the preference was OFF, fines would NOT be disabled and the patron would not be permitted to check out the video that has a rental charge because it would incur fines with push the patron over the acceptable fines limit

section.title: opacsmallimage
section.para: Enter a complete URL (including http://) to an image to replace the default Koha logo.

This field expects a specific image size: the "container" is defined in the stylesheet as 120px x 40px. A smaller image should display fine, but if you want to use a larger image you have to add some custom CSS--preferably by added a custom stylesheet and specifying it in the opaccolorstylesheet system preference

This preference is really only useful if you're swapping in an image that is the same size or smaller. If you're going to go larger, you'll be editing the stylesheet anyway, might as well specify the image source there.
background:transparent url(../../images/my-custom-logo.gif) no-repeat scroll 0% 50%; /* change the url, leave other values intact */
padding:64px 0pt 0pt; /* the first value is the height of your logo */
The url( ... ) value can point to a local or remote file.

section.title: Funds & Budgets

para.emphasis: TIP: Funds may be ignored if you are setting your Global System Preferences for 'Acquisitions' to "simple" acquisitions: the funds are only useful when using "normal" acquisitions.

section.para: "Funds" are accounts that you establish to track your expenditures for library materials. They may be used for any kind of material and should match the lines in your materials budget. For instance, if your library establishes a budget line for books, another for audiovisual materials, a third line for magazines, and a fourth budget line for electronic databases, then you would have four funds.

para.emphasis: TIP: The first time you access this page, you will be asked to add your first fund -- thereafter you will have the option of editing and deleting funds.

listitem.para: Click 'New Fund' add book fund
Each fund has a unique fund code, limited to a maximum of five characters, which identifies it
Enter in a fund name to provide more information for staff members about the fund
Funds can be library/branch specific if needed, but this is an optional field
Once a fund is created a budget can then be applied to it new fund
Click 'Add budget' next to the fund you want to edit
IMPORTANT: Your dates will not save correctly unless you have set your date format ('dateformat') in the Global System Preferences under 'I18N/L10N' -- DO THIS BEFORE setting budgets add budget
Once budgets have been added you can see/search them all by clicking 'Show all budgets' under the list of funds budgets
Budget information will also be accessible via the 'Acquisitions' module acquisitions
From this module you can easily see what has been spent from each budget

section.title: Currencies & Exchange Rates
section.para: Use this section to define exchange rates for vendors in other countries.

listitem.para: Click on 'Currencies and exchange rates' New Currencies
The system comes with some rates pre-programmed. Click Edit or Delete to configure this list for your library.

para.emphasis: TIP: For up-to-date currency information XE.com's Currency Converter: http://www.xe.com/ucc/

listitem.para: To add a new currency click 'New Currency' add currency
Fill in the fields based on the currency you'd like to add and click 'Submit'

para.emphasis: TIP: This information can also be updated from the Acquisitions home page

section.title: Item Types
section.para: This parameter allows you to define what item types you have in your library as well as general circulation rules for these items.

listitem.para: Click on 'Item types' item types
Your system will come with some predefined item types. From this screen you can edit or delete these items
To add a new item type click 'New Item Type' add item type
Enter a short code for the 'Item Type'
Enter a longer explanation in the 'Description'
Feel free to choose an image for each item type (or selected the 'No image' option)
The 'Not for loan' option can be used for items that cannot be checked out of the library

para.emphasis: TIP: If checked, no item of this type can be issued. If not checked, every item of this type can be issued unless notforloan is set for a specific item.

listitem.para: 'Renewals' should include the number of times this item can be renewed
If you charge a rental fee for items (such as DVDs) enter that amount in the 'Rental charge' field
The summary field is used to edit the way this item displays on the search results page

para.emphasis: TIP: For electronic resources you might want to enter open site to show the item link on the search results page

listitem.para: When you're finished click 'Save Changes'

section.title: Authorized Values
section.para: Koha allows you to restrict the values that catalogers can place in some MARC subfields, allowing only certain pre-defined "authorized" values. These authorized values are defined here.

To view the authorized values defined for a category that already exists like 'Lost', choose 'Lost' from the category dropdown menu lost
Then, you can see the values defined for the category "Lost" and edit them if you like.
To add a new value under an existing category, click "New authorized value for" add auth
Enter the value and description and choose an icon if you'd like add auth info
Click on the tabs under 'Choose an Icon' to see different icon sets.

para.emphasis: TIP: If you add new icon sets, a new tab will automatically appear

listitem.para: When finished, click 'Save'

para.emphasis: TIP: The system interprets authorized values of 0 as equaling a null so when you edit a record in cataloging where the authorized value in a field was assigned where the code was 0, the value displays as null in the item editor (or MARC editor). For this reason you should never set the value to 0 for one of your authorized values.

listitem.para: Choose a category from the 'Show Category' dropdown menu
Click 'Edit' beside the authorized value you wish to edit edit auth
Make the changes you'd like and click 'Save'

para.emphasis: TIP: Be careful about changing the 'Authorized value' as it may be associated with existing records.

section.title: Add a new Authorized Value Category

listitem.para: To add a new category, click 'New Category'
Fill in the 'Category', 'Authorized value' and 'Description' fields new auth

para.emphasis: IMPORTANT: The category name must be 8 characters or less. Also, just input one authorized value for the category. You can edit and add more after you save the category.

listitem.para: Click 'Save' # You've added a new category and can immediately start adding more authorized values to that category by clicking "New authorized value for..."

section.title: When editing an item, the new shelving location I created is not showing up by default in the items where I assigned it to.
section.para: This is because you created the new shelving location with a code value of 0 (zero)

Just FYI the system interprets authorized values of 0 as equaling a null so when you edit a record in cataloging where the authorized value in a field was assigned where the code was 0, the value displays as null in the item editor (or MARC editor) instead of the value the library meant it to be.

section.title: "Why would I want to define authorized values for MARC tags?
section.para: Authorized Values create a 'controlled vocabulary' for your staff. As an example, let us assume that your Koha installation is used by several libraries, and you use MARC 21. You might want to restrict the 850a MARC subfield to the institution codes for just those libraries. In that case, you could define an authorized values category (perhaps called "INST") and enter the institution codes as the authorized values for that category.

para.emphasis: TIP: Koha automatically sets up authorized value categories for your item types and branch codes, and you can link these authorized values to MARC subfields when you set up your MARC tag structure.

section.title: Patrons & Circulation
section.para: Settings for controlling circulation and patron information.

section.title: Patron Categories
section.para: The primary function of patron categories is to assist in setting patron loan, request, and fine policies.

listitem.para: Click on 'Patron categories' patron categories
Koha comes with a series of built in categories. These can be edited and/or deleted per your library's needs.

para.emphasis: TIP: You should define (at least) one patron category of type Adult and one of type Staff.

listitem.para: To define a new category, click 'New Category'. new category
Enter in the necessary information for your new category.
Keep your 'Category code' short and three or fewer letters and use the 'Description' to further explain what the code should be used for (this will display in the 'Category name' column)
'Enrollment period' is how long the patron is valid for before they need to renew their card o The age requirements are not required, but are handy to distinguish between adults and children
If you charge a fee for the library card, this goes in the 'Enrollment fee' field
'Overdue notice required' determines which patrons appear in the Overdue Notice/Status Triggers matrix

If you create a patron category that has "overdue notice required" set to "Yes," that means the category will appear in the "Overdue 'Notice/Status Triggers'" matrix. If your patron category has "overdue notice required" set to "No," that patron category will not appear in the triggers matrix.
'Reserve fee' is a fee for placing holds on items
'Category type' is programmed into the system as follows: category type
Staff = A user that can be configured to perform functions in the staff client
Adult = An average patron (can have child patrons under it)
Child = A patron who must have an adult guarantor
Organization = An organization that can have professional patrons under it
Professional = A patron that can have an organization as a guarantor
Statistical = A "fake" library card. When items are scanned onto a Statistical patron card, the items are not checked out, but recorded.

para.emphasis: TIP: This can be used to record statistics of items that are used, but do not get checked out, such as reference items, magazines, etc. You can run a report to gather the statistics from this card.

listitem.para: After entering the necessary information click 'Save'
Your new patron category will now be listed with the others

section.title: Cities & Towns
section.para: This parameter helps you define the cities and towns that your patrons live in.

listitem.para: Click 'New City'
Enter the city or town name and the zipcode
Click 'Submit' * You can edit/delete your cities and towns from the main 'Cities and towns' page city list
These fields will then appear when adding/editing a patron as a pull down to make it easier to enter data

section.title: Road Types
section.para: The values defined in this preference will show up in a pull down menu when entering patron information. These values can be used in geographic statistics.

listitem.para: Click 'New Road Type' new road type
Enter a value such as Blvd., Avenue, Street or St.
Click 'Submit'
Your values will appear on the Road Types page road list
Your values will also appear as authorized values when entering or editing a patron

section.para: To use this tool you simply need the barcode for the book you'd like to print the spine label for.

listitem.para: Define the fields you want to print on the spine label in the SpineLabelFormat system preference
Get there: More > Administration > Global System Preferences > Cataloging > SpineLabelFormat
Format your label printing by editing spinelabel.css found in koha-tmpl/intranet-tmpl/prog/en/css/
